meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Barghouti Pulls Out Of Palestinian Race The imprisoned leader of the Palestinian uprising, Marwan Barghouti, withdrew from the Palestinian presidential race after waging an on-again-off-again campaign from his prison cell. The decision removes any serious challenge to the P.L.O. chairman, Mahmoud Abbas, in the Jan. 9 election for a successor to Yasir Arafat.
PAGE A16

Saluting a New Climate Pact Delegates from more than 190 countries have gathered in Buenos Aires to celebrate the enactment of the Kyoto Protocol, the first treaty limiting greenhouse gases linked to global warming, and to look beyond 2012, when its terms expire.
PAGE A13

NASA Chief to Step Down Sean O'Keefe, the NASA administrator who guided the agency through sweeping changes after the Columbia shuttle accident, will resign after three years and pursue a job as chancellor of Louisiana State University, agency and university officials said.
PAGE A22

The Art of War Steve Mumford, a New York artist embedded with troops in Iraq, has been capturing striking images of the conflict in drawings like ''Artillery Crew in No. CA165,'' a detail of which is above.
THE ARTS, PAGE E1

Financier Sues Hedge Fund Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire financier, has filed a $1 billion lawsuit against the Perry Corporation, a large hedge fund, accusing it and other firms of trying to manipulate the shares and outcomes in several takeover battles. The suit could shine a bright light on the largely unregulated hedge fund industry.
PAGE C1

Barghouti Pulls Out Of Palestinian Race The imprisoned leader of the Palestinian uprising, Marwan Barghouti, withdrew from the Palestinian presidential race after waging an on-again-off-again campaign from his prison cell. The decision removes any serious challenge to the P.L.O. chairman, Mahmoud Abbas, in the Jan. 9 election for a successor to Yasir Arafat.

Financier Sues Hedge Fund Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire financier, has filed a $1 billion lawsuit against the Perry Corporation, a large hedge fund, accusing it and other firms of trying to manipulate the shares and outcomes in several takeover battles. The suit could shine a bright light on the largely unregulated hedge fund industry.
